file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 33-50-04-05 - BATTERY POWER SUPPLY - ADJUSTMENT/TEST

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL BATTERY POWER SUPPLY - ADJUSTMENT/TEST EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to do the functional check of the Battery Power Supply. B. The Battery Power Supply supplies DC power to the electrically-illuminated emergency exit signal and lights when the normal electrical power supply is lost. C. The Battery Power Supply includes a battery pack and an electronic assembly mounted on a chassis. D. There are four Battery Power Supplies installed on the aircraft as follows: (1) Battery Power Supply 1 - Installed on the right side of the fuselage, between the TCAS computer and the cockpit wall. (2) Battery Power Supply 2 - Installed at the ceiling, above the service door. (3) Battery Power Supply 3 - Installed below the floor panel (on the single-passenger seat side). (4) Battery Power Supply 4 - Installed at the ceiling (third passenger window, after the emergency exit). E. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY ALL 33-50-04-700-801-A ♦ BATTERY PACK - FUNCTIONAL CHECK EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 33-50-04 Page 1 of 3 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-50-04-700-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. BATTERY PACK - FUNCTIONAL CHECK A. General (1) The function of this check is to make sure that the battery power supply is in good functional condition. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM TASK 33-50-04-000-802-A/400 BATTERY PACK - REMOVAL AMM TASK 33-50-04-400-802-A/400 BATTERY PACK - INSTALLATION C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 155 251JF Wing stub - LH 232 Aft wardrobe 234 Passenger cabin ceiling - RH 253 Passenger cabin ceiling - LH D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task In the passenger cabin I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Remove the battery pack ( AMM TASK 33-50-04-000-802-A/400). J. Functionally Check Battery Pack SUBTASK 720-002-A (1) This item is applicable to all Battery Power Supply part numbers, except for part number 100865 manufactured after Aug 20/02. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 33-50-04 Page 2 of 3 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (a) Refer to the last revision of CMM 25-60-03 (Radiant Power Corp.) to do the emergency-lighting-system battery test and put the battery pack back to a serviceable condition. (2) This item is applicable to Battery Power Supply part number 100865 manufactured after Aug 20/02. (a) Refer to the last revision of CMM 33-21-70 (Bruce Industries) to do the emergency-lighting-system battery test and put the battery pack back to a serviceable condition. K. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Install the battery pack ( AMM TASK 33-50-04-400-802-A/400). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 700-801-A/500 33-50-04 Page 3 of 3 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A.
